Description: Flint tool/implement, with bulb of percussion.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Amarna, el-, TA:20-21/40 Main City, house 0.48.17 One of eleven flint tools (including British Museum EA 67632-5, 67638) found in a medium-sized house, with painted panels in its central room. Other finds included a faience ring-bezel, bone tools, a wooden comb, a bronze model of an ox leg and a limestone figure of a monkey. The house experienced at least two occupation phases within the Amarna period, with two distinct brick flooring levels found in one space
Curator's comments: Peet and Woolley, City of Akhenaten I (1923): 28-9 [description of house and finds]. Large groups of flint blades and tools have been recovered from other New Kingdom settlement sites. See, for example, Giddy, Survey of Memphis II (1999: 226-43).
